1. TASK: Update the frontend so the AI button (id="enhancePrompt") appears as a small circular overlay in the top-right corner of the prompt textarea. Only change CSS and minimal HTML structure if absolutely necessary, preserving element IDs and existing JS behavior. 2. EXPECTED OUTCOME: Update public/styles.css (and public/index.html only if necessary) so that: - The AI button is 32px by 32px (or similar), circular, with an icon/text 'AI' centered. - The button overlays the prompt textarea in the top-right corner with an 8px inset. - The textarea has sufficient right padding so typed text is never obscured by the button. - The overlay respects focus and hover states (visible focus ring, subtle enlarge on hover, obeys prefers-reduced-motion). - On small screens (<=600px) the button moves to the top-right of the prompt area but outside (so it doesn't cover text), still accessible. - No JS/ID changes; event listeners continue to work. Success criteria: - Visual: Button sits atop the textarea (not pushing layout) and does not overlap typed text. - Functional: Clicking the button triggers existing handler (elements.enhancePrompt). No JS changes required. 3. REQUIRED SKILLS: Frontend UI/CSS design, responsive CSS, accessibility (focus states), familiarity with project file structure. 4. REQUIRED TOOLS: read, edit, write, bash (run build), lsp_diagnostics. Do not add dependencies. 5. MUST DO: - Add CSS: .prompt-row { position: relative } if not present. - Add CSS for .ai-btn to be absolutely positioned in top-right of .prompt-row with width/height 32px, border-radius:50%, centered label, accessible aria-label should already exist. - Add textarea padding-right equal to button width + 16px gap. - Add hover/focus styles and transition (respect prefers-reduced-motion) - Add media query @media (max-width:600px) to reposition button to inline-right (not overlapping), or reduce absolute inset so it does not hide content. - Keep IDs and HTML structure unchanged unless absolutely necessary; if changing HTML, update app.js only if required and minimal. - Run npm run build and run lsp_diagnostics (where applicable) and report any issues. 6. MUST NOT DO: - Do not modify element IDs or existing JS behavior. - Do not remove or rename enhancePrompt, prompt, or other controls. - Do not edit server code. - Do not add new npm packages. 7.
